text: now you see it ecoli bacteria with a
neat cell wall now you don't its blob
time plants fungi and bacteria all have
highly structured cell walls to keep
their shape but the bacteria sometimes
dissolve those walls for instance when
they're attacked by an immune system
they live for a few generations as
spherical blobs contained only by
membranes then astonishingly they
rebuild researchers at Stanford recorded
and tested the rebuilding and what they
found was that one protein ruled the
whole process it's called MRE B and it
was known to help maintain cell walls
but what the researchers found is that
it can rebuild them from scratch
it's the coordinator of the enzymes that
actually build the walls you could say
it's the organizer behind the
reconstruction of the e.coli Empire
you
